meanings.definition: The process of magnetizing or the state of being magnetized.
meanings.sent1: The magnetization of the metal made it attract other objects.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the magnetization of different materials in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The magnetization of the fridge magnet was so strong that it pulled in all the paper clips.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a magnetic magnetization that drew people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The magnetization of the compass needle pointed north with great precision.

meanings.definition: The act or process of imparting magnetic properties to a material.
meanings.sent1: The magnetization of the iron increased its ability to attract other metals.
meanings.sent2: The engineer focused on the magnetization of the steel to make it suitable for the project.
meanings.sent3: The magnetization of the toy car made it stick to the fridge like a magnet.
meanings.sent4: The magnetization of the music in the room created a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The magnetization of the bar magnet transformed the paper clips into a chain.
